title: Community Geography and Mapping

vocab.definition: A picture that shows where places are located
A place where people live, work, and play together
The area around where you live
An important building or place that helps people know where they are
Ways to tell someone how to get from one place to another

teachingNotes: Use simple maps of the school and local community. Practice basic directions (left, right, north, south). Have students draw maps of their classroom or bedroom. Identify local landmarks.

sample.question: What do we call the area around where you live?
Name a landmark near your home.
What does a compass rose show?
What do we use maps for?
What is a community?
expectedAny: place where people live, work, and play together

sample.question: Why are landmarks helpful?
expectedAny: help us know where we are

truefalse.question: A map shows us where different places are located.
A neighborhood is part of a community.
Landmarks are not useful for directions.
A globe is a model of Earth.
East is the opposite of west.
Maps only show roads, not buildings.

multiplechoice.question: Which tool shows directions on a map?
If you go north and then turn right, which direction are you facing?
Which is part of your community?
A map key (legend) tells you what?
Which is NOT a cardinal direction?

fillintheblank.question: People live, work, and play together in a ________.
A picture that shows where places are is called a ___.
The directions north, south, east, west are called ________ directions.
A ________ helps people know where they are.
The area around where you live is your ________.
A ________ is a model of the Earth.
A map ________ tells what symbols mean.

shortanswer.question: Name two landmarks in your community.
How can a map help you get to a friend's house?
expectedAny: shows where the friend's house is
helps you follow streets to the house

shortanswer.question: Describe how to get from your classroom to the library using directions.
expectedAny: go out the door, turn left, walk to the end
exit classroom, turn right, go straight to library
walk forward two rows, turn left and go to the library

shortanswer.question: What symbols might you put on a map of your room?
Why do people use maps instead of just guessing?
What is one difference between a map and a globe?
expectedAny: map is flat, globe is round
map is flat and shows one area, globe is round and shows whole planet

shortanswer.question: Give directions from the door to your desk.
expectedAny: go straight and turn left at the bookshelf
turn right after the coat hooks and the desk is the third on the left
walk forward three steps then turn left to your desk
